newsitem.title: UK: British universities in cloak-and-dagger bond deal.
newsitem.headline: British universities in cloak-and-dagger bond deal.

text.p: A group of anonymous British universities has banded together to raise 49 million pounds ($79.6 million) in international capital markets, arranger Bankers Trust said on Friday.
Bankers Trust, which arranged the 29-year transaction for Varsity Funding (Holdings) Ltd, a special purpose vehicle, would only say that the deal has got underlying university-linked notes.

Bankers Trust vice-president head of Eurobond syndication Vincent Keith told Reuters: "It's a grey box structure. People know that the underlying notes are university obligations secured by prime university properties. Beyond that it's wrapped by FSA."

The deal is guaranteed by Financial Security Assurance, a company which specialises in insuring bond issues. FSA's backing meant the notes carry AAA ratings from both Moody's Investor Service and Standard and Poor's Corp.

The notes will be priced later to yield 65 basis points over Britain's 8.00 percent gilt due 2021. The coupon will step up by 0.25 percentage point per annum until 2007. The bond then amortises until maturity, giving an average life of just over 22 years. ($ = 0.615 British Pounds) -- Dan Lalor, London newsroom +44 171 542 8863
